sentences.en: As the happy time drew near, the lions and tigers climbing up the bedroom walls became quite tame and frolicsome.
sentences.cn: 当快乐的时光愈来愈临近的时候，卧室墙上爬着的狮子和老虎变得十分驯服和爱闹着玩了。

sentences.en: Frolicsome students celebrated their graduation with parties and practical jokes.
sentences.cn: 爱玩闹的学生们举行聚会,制造各种恶作剧来庆祝毕业.

sentences.en: Grass was awarded the Nobel Prize in 1999 for his "frolicsome black fables [which] portray the forgotten face of history".
sentences.cn: 格拉斯因他“嬉闹的黑色寓言、描绘历史被遗忘的一面”获得1999年诺贝尔文学奖。

sentences.en: In the not too distant future. When the pup had grown lanky and 26)frolicsome—the wolf would return to the mountainside.
sentences.cn: 在不远的将来，当小狗崽长到可以四处奔跑嬉戏的时候——狼会回到山坡。

sentences.en: In the not too distant future.When the pup had grown lanky and 26)frolicsome—the wolf would return to the mountainside.
sentences.cn: 在不远的将来，当小狗崽长到可以四处奔跑嬉戏的时候——狼会回到山坡。

sentences.en: In the not too distant future.When the pup had grown lanky and frolicsome—the wolf would return to the mountainside.
sentences.cn: 在不远的将来，当小狗崽长到可以四处奔跑嬉戏的时候——狼会回到山坡。

sentences.en: To amuse ( oneself ) a light, frolicsome manner.
sentences.cn: 欢娱,使欢乐:以轻松 、 快乐的方式使 ( 自己 ) 娱乐.

trans.tran_en: given to frolicking; merry and playful
